description: Blend of cybernetic +â€Ž organism. Coined by Austrian neuroscientist Manfred Clynes in 1960.

entries.meaning: (science fiction) A being which is part machine and part organic.
examples: I would not classify the Tin Woodman as magical robot, but more of a magical cyborg, if anything.

entries.meaning: A human, animal or other being with electronic or bionic prostheses.

verbs.description: cyborg (third-person singular simple present cyborgs, present participle cyborging, simple past and past participle cyborged)

entries.meaning: (science fiction) To convert (something) into a cyborg.
